data.title: Add popular tmlanguages
data.body:
For great victory.

Represents a set of [popular languages](https://github.com/languages), plus some stuff that's required for github/github and github/atom. 

As far as "required" packages I think this is it.

Maybe I should just bite the bullet, do a sweep of all popular languages on GitHub, and add them submodules. Or even replicate the default list that comes out of ST2. Would that be useful?

data.body:
Now that we have web worker support we can level-up all the Git things.

This is not ready to merge yet.

data.title: Changing the font size of a mini editor changes the font size for all editors
data.body:
I'm using a mini editor as the CLI for the vim package I'm working on. When setting the font size for the mini editor it also changes all other editors.

There should be a way to build a new mini editor with a fixed font size.

data.title: Spell check
data.body:
- Displays corrections on `meta-0`
- Initially enabled for:
  - Plain text files
  - Markdown files
  - Git commit messages
- Can be styled with the `.misspelling` class.

data.title: Show git status in fuzzy finder
data.body:
It'd be awesome if this showed icons with the git status (modified mostly):

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2/198764/620ed5d6-8065-11e2-9a57-9caf9f698d09.png)

data.title: Atom does not check for updates when run with --dev
Support for privilege escalation
data.body:
I edit my `/etc/hosts` file a lot to work with Enterprise VMs. My typical workflow for that is to run `subl /etc/hosts`, edit the file, `cmd-s`, and then I get prompted for my password since it's trying to save and my user doesn't have permission to.

In Atom, it opens the file just fine, but when I try saving the dev tools pane pops up and I see this in the javascript console:

```
Uncaught Error: You don’t have permission to save the file “hosts” in the folder “etc”.
```

It would be cool if we had support for nicely handling cases where you try saving files that require privilege escalation to write.

data.title: Native Emoji Support
data.body:
It would be awesome to support native emoji.

Right now I just see nothing when I try to paste one in:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2/194137/1ce00c46-7f9d-11e2-93bf-75ee5e37189c.png)

Compare to Safari:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2/194139/23bff062-7f9d-11e2-9f3f-37606e39500d.png)

Though unfortunately Chrome is broken too, so maybe this isn't something we can fix:

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2/194145/3f9ae04e-7f9d-11e2-8371-1145c38601d9.png)

data.title: Weird state after pressing escape
data.body:
I hit `escape` while the File Browser had focus and that caused the File Browser to disappear. After that, hitting `cmd-\` had no effect. Quitting and opening again didn't clear the problem, so it seems like it's saved in the project state. Per @probablycorey I hit `alt-cmd-i` to bring up the dev tools and tried running `localStorage.clear()` to try clearing the project state, but that just returned `undefined`. Opening up other projects displays the File Browser as expected.

I'm able to reproduce this on any project.

data.title: Large file support
data.body:
So, I use my text editor for all kinds of things (writing code, reading readmes, editing dotfiles, etc). One of the things I do most often during any given day is open up large log files to troubleshoot Enterprise problems. These files can sometimes get as large as 500-800MB.

I just tried viewing a 350MB log file and Atom locked up immediately -- the file selector didn't change and the entire window went completely white 4 seconds after I tried viewing the file. I could still close the top level window, but we should still have better handling for this kind of thing.

Sublime Text 2 took about 55 seconds to open the file, but gave a nice progress indicator while it was loading:

![Screen Shot 2013-02-24 at 4 50 56 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/244/190379/c0abc27e-7ee5-11e2-8ec4-4205cdee0ad0.png)

Once it loaded it was as responsive as any other file I load (scrolled fast, normal text highlight performance, etc). It would be nice if we set this as a baseline for expected behavior (progress bar + responsive after loading).

data.title: Merge dev into master
data.body:
# Highlights
- TOML support
- clojure bundle now included by default
- yaml bundle now included by default
- another new icon
- Spell checking

data.body:
I think it's pretty straight forward, but I would love to be able to:
1. Press meta-p 
2. Type something like "Checkout Branch"
3. Either get a set of possible options of branches to change to _-or-_ ability to create a new branch

Just a :thought_balloon: long term. Keep killin' it!

data.title: Nested Modified Indicators
data.body:
What would you think about indicating directories that have modified diff changes?

I love that the files themselves have class indicators that things have changed, but if a directory is collapsed, I have no indication that anything has changed inside. Could be a really interesting way to overview what's been changed.

Perhaps a 'contains-modified' class?

data.title: Move atom cli creation out of Rakefile and into the app
Move .atom creation out of Rakefile and into the app
Markdown Error Pasting Python Script
data.body:
I had some Python I was attempting to paste into a markdown document and kept getting the error: `TypeError: Object invisible leading-whitespace has no method 'push'`

After that I, regrettably pulled up Sublime, and attempted to add the text. I added it, saved it, and then tried pulling it back up in Atom, and as expected, got an error.

Below is the stack trace:

> TypeError: Object invisible leading-whitespace has no method 'push'
>     at Token.module.exports.Token.getValueAsHtml (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/token.coffee:121:41)
>     at module.exports.Editor.buildLineHtml (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:2075:27)
>     at module.exports.Editor.buildLinesHtml (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:1992:29)
>     at module.exports.Editor.buildLineElementsForScreenRows (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:1976:28)
>     at eval (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:1925:26)
>     at module.exports.Editor.fillDirtyRanges (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:1933:14)
>     at module.exports.Editor.updateRenderedLines (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:1779:12)
>     at module.exports.Editor.updateDisplay (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:1664:12)
>     at module.exports.Editor.scrollTop (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:1210:31)
>     at module.exports.Editor.setScrollPositionFromActiveEditSession (/Users/sroberts/github/atom/src/app/editor.coffee:1310:12) index.html:23
> Uncaught TypeError: Object invisible leading-whitespace has no method 'push' 

Screenshot:
![Screen Shot 2013-02-21 at 6 31 01 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/44774/182957/2c07c888-7c7f-11e2-8140-67a6035daef0.png)

Any help would be appreciated.

data.title: Text selection not respecting OS X normalcies for underscored words
data.body:
The default behavior on OS X when double clicking or using option-arrow to select things is to treat a word with underscores as a single word. Hyphened words stop at the hyphen.

Atom is stopping at the underscore. This goes against the native behavior of text selection on OS X.
### Everything on OS X (native)

![Screen Shot 2013-02-21 at 1 49 26 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/260/181718/8ca63c42-7c57-11e2-8db7-edd2749fb418.png)
### Atom

![Screen Shot 2013-02-21 at 1 49 43 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/260/181720/9aa18c52-7c57-11e2-97fe-23f7a3db1145.png)

data.title: Make pane system available for more than just editors
data.body:
Work in progress – Not ready to be merged

The central idea of this pull request is that anybody should be able to add items to panes. Right now, panes, tabs, and other functionality is very hard-coded to the editor use case. But what about opening an image viewer / editor or a markdown preview? Or something else? Our current arrangement falls down.

Now, panes are a much more central part of the view system. Panes have multiple items, and pane items can either be regular views _or_ they can be model objects. When you add a model object as a pane item, that object needs a `getViewClass` method to instruct the pane on how it should be rendered.

So now, instead of editors managing multiple edit sessions, edit sessions will just be added as pane items, and the pane will attach an editor and assign its edit session when it needs to render an edit session item. Any other types of items can follow a similar course.

Everything is ripped apart right now, but that's the goal.
- [x] Extract a pane container view for dealing with pane layout and other pane-spanning behavior
- [x] Make pane-splitting general, so that editor / edit session don't need to know about it
- [x] Rename Pane.currentItem/View to activeItem/View
- [x] Remove pane-splitting code from editor
- [x] Remember which pane was last focused (activePane)
- [x] Handle core:close event on pane
- [x] Revamp tabs to work with panes / pane items instead of editors / edit sessions
- [x] Support reordering items
- [x] Support moving items from one pane to another
- [x] Remove code for dealing with multiple edit sessions on editor
- [x] Make fuzzy finder work without reliance on editors having multiple edit sessions
- [x] Fix fuzzy finder splitting
- [x] Remove getActiveEditor. Root view should speak in terms of panes / items
- [x] Replace edit-session-removed events with their pane-item equivalent
- [x] Set the project path in the model layer when one of its edit sessions is first saved, not in the root view when focus shifts
- [x] Make tabs indicate when something is modified
- [x] Prompt when closing modified pane items
- [x] Handle save / save as on panes instead of editor
- [x] Handle saveAll on pane container
- [x] Move autosave to panes
- [x] Support destroying pane items other than the current
- [x] Support destroying all pane items and closing the pane
- [x] Numeric bindings for tab-switching should work
- [x] eliminate fixturesProject
- [x] Support reopening of most recently closed pane item
- [x] Title is not updating when an untitled file is saved for the first time
- [x] Restore root view serialization specs
- [x] Version the serialized window state and blow it away or migrate it if it gets stale

data.title: Insert line above
data.body:
`meta+return` inserts a new line below.

In Sublime Text 2 I constantly use new line above, as well.

So, it would be cool if `meta+shift+return` inserted new line above.

data.title: Pasting multiple lines to the end of the buffer bugs text rendering
data.body:
When pasting in multiple lines from an IM in iMessage to Atom text rendering bugged:

![Screen Shot 2013-02-20 at 1 12 18 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/44774/177120/a049c4ee-7b8a-11e2-9097-0ad3aaff4f4b.png)

For another good example look at the yellow underscores at the end of the line… those are supposed to be the underlines under the () for syntax highlighting, when I delete the last space on the line the () part pops up to the right line and is underscored correctly:

![Screen Shot 2013-02-20 at 1 16 06 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/44774/177122/b25caca0-7b8a-11e2-8748-8464b89a3625.png)

data.title: Text selection is slow
data.body: Dragging a selection over a text buffer seems to stick on each row, or skip rows, making the  effect seem choppy.  It's hard to articulate this performance problem, but comparing the selection speed to TextEdit is a good way to see it in action.
